attributes.action: Consolidate mobile telephone infrastructure networks under one umbrella company
attributes.background: Many of us consumers choose a mobile provider based on coverage in the areas where we live and work. But when we travel we often find connectivity is poor (or non-existent) in certain areas if we are customers of the wrong provider.
attributes.additional_details: If the network infrastructure were to become owned by one umbrella company, then we could have excellent coverage no matter with which provider we were customers. The providers would then have a similar business relationship with the umbrella company as train operators have with Network Rail, or broadband providers have with BT Openreach. In attracting customers, providers could no longer rely on coverage, but would need to find innovative ways to be competitive.

attributes.action: Where possible, make it policy for cars used by all authorities, be British made
attributes.background: It only seems logical for cars used by the police force, or even any other public body, buy cars with the vast majority of their supply chain in Britain - as long as the car serves that particular purpose and is cost effective. Not only does it decrease a carbon footprint, it safeguards an industry.

attributes.action: Create more opportunities to further vocational subject skills in state schools.
attributes.background: In state education here in the U.K our youth have next to no chances to properly further their vocational skills, e.g dance! Many schools not offering a thing in some of these areas that could potentially be the child's gift in life! For many school is the only outlet for them to progress in this.
attributes.additional_details: Focus on sporting and academic departments take away sometimes completely from the vocational or artistic side. If that is a career a youth would want to pursue then it is the EDUCATION systems duty to EDUCATE the students on such matters! But no input or teaching on these skills are taught, hindering the abilities of our youths and holding them back from their potential, MANY, MANY people have a skill in vocational activities and subjects that could lead to a career in it.

attributes.action: Change the Student Loan to allow Student Exchange Programs
attributes.background: The Government should allow the student loan scheme to include loans for Student/Foreign Exchange Programs for those wanting to go beyond the European grant of study grant which maybe abolished after Brexit which means the Government must inclue a scheme/loan for Student/Foreign Exchange Program.

attributes.action: Stop the use of snail slime in beauty products.
attributes.background: The producers/companies agitate and scare the snails using shock/salt to get the desired level of secretion. This is harming and torturing the snails for the use of snail slime in beauty products. It is inhumane, and no animal should be treated this way.

attributes.action: Prevent employers making employees pay for company uniforms.
attributes.background: It is unfair that employees should have to pay for uniforms which are mainly intended to provide corporate identity, especially those which display company logos.  Deductions from wages for staff uniforms may render earnings below the minimum wage as a result.

attributes.action: Give Schools more funding to improve technology and buy new computers.
attributes.background: Schools need more funding to improve their technology as most of their equipment is up to 10 years old and needs tonne upgraded with newer technology / computers to help inprove children's learning.

attributes.action: Give more advice and provide help for free to the parents of obese children.
attributes.background: Children who are obese have higher risks of heart disease and other illnesses so it would be very important to lower the numbers of kids who are in need of help. Providing more help by making their parents aware of this and sending them free leaflets on how to help their child(ren) would be helpful.
attributes.additional_details: The number of obese children would change dramatically and fall if further support was given to parents or careers of children. Obesity levels in the UK are really high compared to other European countries and the world. Meal plans, guidance and leaflets with facts on obesity should be given to parents or careers so they can help their child lose weight and decrease chances of breathing difficulty, high blood pressure or a stroke in the future.

attributes.action: Review the current deportation system, and address its surrounding concerns.
attributes.background: Review gov. process of deportations, particularly through charter flights; address their impact on detainees. Address the impact of deportation centres, especially on children. Address lack of care for legal proceedings and claims before deportations. Address violence and racism on charter flights.
attributes.additional_details:
People subject to the UK deportation system are in a vulnerbale place, and there are many issues which need to be addressed.

I have written an article with references: http://writingco.tumblr.com/post/157272986629/secretive-night-flights-the-uks-un-reviewed 

Most powerful sources: http://www.medicaljustice.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/state-sponsored-cruelty.pdf & http://www.refugeecouncil.org.uk/what_we_do/childrens_services/working_with_age_disputed_children/children_in_detention

attributes.action: Amnesty for illegal immigrants who have avoided detection for 10 years
attributes.background: Amnesty to those who have avoided detection for 10 years would be economically beneficial. These people are unable to contribute to this economy, unable to pay taxes, even though they have been work (cash in hand i.e) and unable to take proper part in society.

attributes.action: Increase the Marriage Tax Allowance
attributes.background: At present more marriage tax relief is afforded couples in their 80s and 90s, than on all other marriages including those caring for young children. Whilst we should of course care for our elderly, we should give a significant married tax break to young families who also need our help.
attributes.additional_details: Philip Hammond under pressure to increase marriage tax allowance: http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/01/16/philip-hammond-pressure-increase-marriage-tax-allowance/

attributes.action: Outlaw anti-abortion campaigns near health centres
attributes.background:
Blown-up, graphic images of abortion, and threats to film people attending BPAS surgeries are likely to scare vulnerable people away from the one place they could get state-sanctioned, impartial advice and assistance.

People have a right to express their views but not in a way that harms others.
attributes.additional_details:
It is well-documented that providing safe, non-judgemental access to health and family planning advice leads to an overall decrease in sexual-health related problems. Aggressive campaigning denies that access. 

Victims of abuse or rape, those who are unsure how to cope with pregnancy, contraceptives or sexual health issues might go away in fear then fail to seek help at all -  disastrous for the victims, and likely to create long-lasting problems for their families and social care services.

attributes.action: PE should not be a core subject in secondary school!
attributes.background: Some students get bullied in PE because they're not good at doing the activities they are told to do e.g running, and some students are not confident enough to do PE. I personally think that PE should not be a core subject, it should be our choice if we want to study this subject or not.
attributes.additional_details: As a GCSE student, I don't think that P.E is going to help us in the future unless we want to become a PE teacher, personal trainer, Athlete etc. Therefore, we should have the right to choose.

attributes.action: Reject Brexit If The UK Fails To Maintain Access To The Single Market
attributes.background: The EU countries make up 53% of  imports and 44% of British exports. Leaving the European Union would put Britains position in the single market in doubt meaning the introduction of tariffs on trade. This would mean an increase in prices of imported products and less foreign investment.

attributes.action: Force any MP or someone standing as an MP, caught lying, to resign
attributes.background:
Any MP or someone standing as an MP who is caught blatantly lying for personal or political gain or for any reason to resign and never be allowed to stand again as an MP
We the people deserve trustworthy MPs and candidates

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for people who have life saving medication.
attributes.background: People who have to pay for prescriptions when they have to take medication for life is wrong. They can't afford it and it is a necessity for them. If they can't afford it, it could mean life or death for them. It's wrong it should be free!

attributes.action: Canadian citizens should be allowed to live in the UK without a residence visa.
attributes.background: Canadians have the oath to The Queen. The UK government should consider Canadians as their fellow home citizens. Canadians should not be treated as foreigners and I believe they should not be restricted to live in their second home by holding a residence visa!
attributes.additional_details: Canadian banknotes, coins, visas and many of the other legal identities have a picture of The Queen.

attributes.action: Have a general election in 2018
attributes.background: The current government is not an elected government as it has completely changed since 2015. Therefore it is making decisions outside of the democratic system. Give the people a voice to decide whether this is the government they want to take them forward.

attributes.action: University Fees paid by Employers’ Graduate Tax – ‘Graduate Bond’ model
attributes.background: This petition proposes free university tuition fees for all students and calls for the universities and employers to bear their fair share of the risks and not just receive the rewards and help to avoid a sub-prime moral hazard student loan debt crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
No university tuition fees for students.
University tuition fees based on projected salary but capped at average actual salary for first 10 years of graduate’s working life.
Employer pays 12% Graduate Tax over 10 years to cover tuition fees plus interest and in return receive corporation tax credit.
Employers’ Graduate Tax expires 15 years after graduation.
Any shortfall will be the University’s risk and gains shared 50/50 between the university and employer.
Read more at the-empty-chair(dot)com

attributes.action: Make primary education optional and let children enjoy their childhood
attributes.background: The human brain is perhaps the most amazing thing ever created. It was designed for fast-paced reaction, cunning development, and sociable interaction, not to be sat in a classroom and given every known fact. The thrill is in seeking the truth for oneself; to experience every aspect of our universe!
attributes.additional_details: Why do we live? There is no fundamental law saying that we must all keep on going, but we do because we want to! Thus, should we live as we do not want? For the true meaning of life is not to learn of the men of old, but to do what one wishes and see this world truly, not through the eyes of "greater" men. Therefore, do not waste the very pinnacle of life with whiteboards and desks and pens, but allow our children to discover the world for themselves and come to love it, and not make them stress, toil and anger over copious works of other people. By this they will be more creative, making their own view, and will lead to a more advanced, happier and better society.

attributes.action: Significantly reduce administration fees for British Nationals living abroad
attributes.background:
Obtaining necessary documents like passports, birth certificates or registering births etc seems to be incredibly, and unjustifiably, expensive for overseas nationals. 

British nationals living overseas should not be penalised in such a way.
attributes.additional_details:
To register the birth of my son, who was born in Japan, will cost £150 to register with a further fee of £50 to obtain a copy of certificate which seems to be to be unjustifiably expensive. Passports, too, also levy a similarly heavy cost with a simple renewal costing more than £100.

These fees should be reduced and brought in-line with admin fees charged at home.

attributes.action: Prevent owners taking their horses on main roads especially during peak hours.
attributes.background: Stop allowing horses to be ridden or pull a cart on main roads. Horses on main roads can cause serious danger and distress to the horse due to fast moving, loud vehicles. It can also cause major distruption for motorists who are often unable to over-take which can lead to queue build up.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 10 incidents involving horses ends in a fatality for individuals and almost always for the horse. Although accidents involving horses are not required to be recorded as an official incident, unless a person is injured, it happens quite frequently and can be traumatising for both horse owners and motorists. 
In the past, I have witnessed a horse being hit on a busy main road. The horse was badly injured and died at the scene. The owner of the horse was also injured and extremely traumatised.

attributes.action: Put legalizing medical cannabis to a referendum/ballot
attributes.background: If the prime minister is willing to quit the common market because of the will of the people then should medical cannabis for the sick be put to a Referendum/ballot to determine the will of the people? And act on it now!

attributes.action: End the discriminatory frozen overseas UK state pension policy in many countries
attributes.background: British pensioners who retire to over 120 countries, mainly Commonwealth, have their rightful state pension frozen impacting lives of 550,000 yet those retiring to other countries have their pension uprated annually, just as though they never left UK. This is discriminatory and causes huge anguish.
attributes.additional_details: More than 95% of the ‘frozen’ pensioners live in Commonwealth countries.The National Insurance Fund is built up from member contributions, including contributions from those who are now frozen! It would cost less than 1% of the annual pension bill to unfreeze pensions. Pensions frozen Australia, Canada, New Zealand, most Commonwealth Countries, and many others. A reciprocal agreement is not needed before they can unfreeze frozen pensions, a simple stroke of the pen could do it.

attributes.action: Benefits for people who are diagnosed with mental health problems.
attributes.background: People who are diagnosed with life long mental health issues, that affect there quality of life, should not be discriminated, it is hard as it is to find and get support when you are diagnosed with mental health problems.
attributes.additional_details: People with mental health issues should be supported by the goverment, and evaluated to see if they are fit to work. There quality of life is much different, and  the goverment lacks the understanding of mental health conditions. It's is near impossible for somone with Bi-polar, ADHD or autisim to find work and should not be left abandoned by the goverment.

attributes.action: free prescriptions to people between 60 and 65 yrs old is wrong
attributes.background: concern for the funding of the NHS

attributes.action: Make it illegal to wear a helmet over 10 years old
attributes.background:
experts within the helmet industry such as Arai, and Shoei. have said that you should change your helmet every 5-7 years.
this is due to the degrading of the polystrene within the helmet, That is the most crucial bit as thats the part that saves you life!

attributes.action: Introduce transparency in property conveycing related charges
attributes.background: When you buy/sell/remortgage a property, the conveyncing solicitors gives you a quote to start with but the final bill is usually twice the quote (specially when buying). You dont even understand the charges they mention in the bill, nor you get a choice at that point and it feels like extortion.
attributes.additional_details: Solicitors fees are usually fixed but other hidden charges increases the finaly bill to twice or even more sometimes. For eg. 1) 'Ground Landlord notice fee' £100! Just to notify the council (land owner) that there is a change in owner. Telegraphic transfer fee £45 (you pay this twice if 2 transfers are to be made). There should transparency in these costs and some standardisation where possible.

attributes.action: Change the law for dog on dog attacks.
attributes.background:
Whilst out walking a friends dog in April 2016 he was attacked whilst on a lead, on a playing field by two other dogs and killed. 
The owner of the two dogs had previously had her dogs on leads and muzzled but took them off so she could play ball with them.
attributes.additional_details: We propose that dog on dog attacks are taken seriously and legislation introduced to convict irresponsible owners whose dogs have attacked those of innocent families and ensure they are held accountable legally for their actions.

attributes.action: Lower  the pension  age to 60  for disabled people
attributes.background: Why make the disable  wait for there pension  until there 65/66  they should have a choice  to retire at 60 or wait until they are 65/66

attributes.action: Stop the eyesight test for the driving practical test.
attributes.background: For anyone going to be doing their driving test or is doing it, I think the eyesight test should not be in place. As long as we can see clearly that's all that matters, I don't see the point in having to read a number plate at a distance. Sign this petition help get the eyesight test removed
attributes.additional_details:
Well for those who fail and keep failing their driving test. if we fail so many times then get a refund. I have failed a few times and still booking for more.

Would be fair if we are able to get a refund for the driving test booking fee if we fail 3 times.

attributes.action: Pay for free access to M6 Toll during planned roadworks on the M5/M6 this year.
attributes.background: The M5 viaduct between junctions 1 and 2 is being repaired this year. Each carriageway will be closed in turn to allow the deck to be replaced causing the liability of severe congestion. This will back up in both directions. Add repairs to M6 junction 7 and the likelihood is chaos.
attributes.additional_details:
Opening the M6 Toll would take some of the pressure off the M6 for traffic heading to London and other south eastern areas, and off the M5 as traffic could head round the M42.

The costs to the economy of traffic being delayed will be huge.

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/highways-england-begins-vital-maintenance-work-on-m6

http://www.expressandstar.com/news/transport-news/2016/11/14/m5-roadworks-motorists-facing-months-of-misery-with-repairs-planned-to-crumbling-viaduct/

attributes.action: Stop GM wheat planting in the UK!
attributes.background: The Government has given permission for GM wheat crops to be tested again in the UK.  The last time they tried this, it did not work and cost the public £3m.  Birds will pick ears and drop them in non-GM fields, which will make normal wheat infertile and will seriously affect organic farms.
attributes.additional_details: The Soil Association, GM Freeze (an association of over 30 organisations) and most UK farmers are totally against GM crops. There is no way to confine this to the planting area, as has been proved in the US and most US farmers have stopped planting this as consumers didn't want it.

attributes.action: Stop university grants to be given based on household income in The UK.
attributes.background: As many people my age from 18-21, it's ridiculous that the government expect for a household income to have a link between my financial status and a household income, and a greater majority will have no financial help from these 'dependant people'.
attributes.additional_details: I believe this needs to be re-looked at and this is not not blindlessly asking for more money for everyone but letting those who need help and work hard for themselves with no financial help not struggle!

attributes.action: Sociology should be taught across all key stages, starting from primary school
attributes.background: Sociology is fundamental in understanding our social world, and this gives the opportunity to develop critical thinking skills.This is a positive thing, as people can share their views and in doing this, improving society. Sociology is important as it explains our functioning in daily life.
attributes.additional_details: 'I had always looked down on sociology as this arriviste discipline. It didn't have the noble history of English and history as a subject. But once I had a little exposure to it, I said, 'Hey, here's the key. Here's the key to understanding life and all its forms.' Tom Wolfe

attributes.action: Shorten School Days For Public High Schools
attributes.background: When I go to school all the work piles up sometimes and becomes really stressful, however when I get home there is not enough time to relax, do work, eat then sleep enough for the next day of school, I know a lot of others feel this way and I hope this gets solved.

attributes.action: Make the Pigeon our first national bird!
attributes.background: Pigeons are everywhere and are part of our current day-to-day lives.

attributes.action: private rented properties should be checked and certified  by council yearly.
attributes.background: council should check every property before allowing them to be rented out and should make a certain rules for estate agent to deal with tenant and protecting them.
attributes.additional_details: the flat i am renting is full of moulds, when i send my complain to estate agent in stead of resolving it and send me eviction letter !!! i am asking local council to protect tenants.

attributes.action: Stop penalising ex Veterens on their war pensions.
attributes.background: I want the government to stop penalising ex veterans who claim a war pension, but have to surrender most of it because they are out of work and claim benefits.

attributes.action: Exempt Landlords from Stamp Duty if let to a local authority or Housing Trust
attributes.background:
Growing shortage of affordable property to rent.

Incentivise Landlords to rent to the public sector for a minimum of 5 years below market rates, in return for tax and duty relief.

Also introduce enhanced Interest Relief for long term Landlords committing to a 10 year or more investment term.
attributes.additional_details:
Stamp Duty & the reduction in interest relief has made investment in residential property much less favourable, the result, less investment in BuytoLet (BTL) properties and landlords have been selling existing stock ahead of the changes.

This reduction in stock and the high demand, will inevitably lead to  rent increases.

Incentivise investment by exempting Stamp Duty on all property let to the public sector for a 5 years term, long term landlords should benefit from enhanced interest relief

attributes.action: Exempt charge of £30(min)for letter to Unis from GPs re health of applicants.
attributes.background: Daughter has applied to Universities who requested letter from GP regarding her health. Local surgery have insisted on a payment of £30 claiming this is a NON-NHS service (apparently charges £30-55). How come a 'sick note' non chargeable to adults but students need to pay for a simple letter?
attributes.additional_details: The GP surgery required a payment of £30.  When questioned the Assistant Practice Manager advised that payment was in line with Government guidelines of £30- 55.  Personally think this is outrageous given students now required to pay for education and this is another hidden cost to any student wanting to go to Uni (costs of which are prohibitive to most).

attributes.action: Create independent organisations to run the NHS and Education
attributes.background: The NHS and Education are perpetual footballs for politicians.  They see them as their way of "making policy" and "changing Britain".  In the same way as was done with the Bank of England, both the NHS and Education should be taken out of politics, and run by independent, expert organisations.
attributes.additional_details: Let's stop perpetual political reforms of the NHS and Education in the UK, and create stability.  Let's also stop politicians who have zero experience in health or education from making policy, and leave instead trust these tasks to panels of experts.  Only this way can be bring stability to, and take forward, our beloved organisations.

attributes.action: refunds should be given for bets placed on non starters
attributes.background: many punters are losing out in singles doubles trebles fc/tc. placepots etc. I and the majority if not all punters would like a refund if a horse refuses to start the race. It is wrong at the highest level. we don't want a free bet where you don't get your stake back. we just want refunded.
attributes.additional_details: 3.10 Newcastle 23 January 2017 horse Bigirononhiship failed to start. no run for my money I lost single and fc bet placed.

attributes.action: Road improvements to dual carriageway between Polegate to Lewis
attributes.background: With the increased housing developments in and around Eastbourne and Polegate causing more traffic congestion along the A27 between Polegate to Lewis it's now time to dual carriageway this section of road

attributes.action: be able to self-exclude from book makers and casinos for more then a year
attributes.background: I know from experience and self banning use to be five years now it's only one year and that's not enough we should at least have a right to choose how long we can ban ourselves for.

attributes.action: Professionals completing babies checks, to screen mums for PND during 1st year
attributes.background: I am a mum of two children. I suffered PND with my second child. I had been to gp before birth but was told too close to birth to be given medication. I was then left and not checked. 14wks post birth I was in a really dark, scary place. Had it been checked during those 1st weeks id had gotten help

attributes.action: When referring to our Debt state what we owe not what % it is of something else.
attributes.background: Since 1947 our Debt increased from £25 bn to £1,547 bn but when compared to GDP it allows Gov to conceal from us their out of control spending and borrowing of more than £2 bn every week for 10 years. For more alarming facts about the way Gov run our Country see www.mrms.uk
attributes.additional_details: A debt is “a sum of money owed” and should be referred to as such. There is no logical reason why Government should compare our National Debt to GDP (or anything else) other than to keep the truth from us of their out of control spending and borrowing.

attributes.action: Reading Prison as an Enterprise Zone for new Businesses.
attributes.background: This petition proposes the multiuse development of Reading Prison. The Grade II-listed building would be used as a ‘Business Incubator’ where start-up companies share communal infrastructure but operate within a designated space themselves. The remaining site would be a residential development.
attributes.additional_details:
This site is perfect for new businesses, with access to the station as well as supporting industries in the surrounding area.
Existing centres of innovation (The University and Business parks) could be sources of collaboration.
Ernst and Young forecasts Reading to be the fastest growing local economy in the UK, making this a pivotal moment in Reading's economic future.
The prison site will enable a diverse range of new businesses to develop, further spreading Reading’s prosperity.

attributes.action: Criminal Justice System to accept polygraph results as evidence.
attributes.background: For serious offences a Polygraph test should be used as evidence. For crimes such as historic child abuse where independent witnesses will not really exist. As nearly all children who are abused will by themselves. These results should be used or funding for research should be given.
attributes.additional_details:
We want the results to be used or funding granted to make these tests more accurate. 
 
Some people believe that the lie detectors are 90% accurate when other believe they are around 70% accurate. http://abcnews.go.com/US/story?id=92847

When eyewitness statements are used as evidence and their accuracy can be within this %.

What we want is some form of lie detector to be used in the near future as evidence.

attributes.action: The Jury Should be Scrapped.
attributes.background: I feel that the jury should be scrapped due to the impact that the decision will have on the persons life. If the ECJ doesn't use a jury, why should other courts.
